maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows for selected objects alerts raised during the selected report duration and for given filter parameters.
For a given set of objects this report will show all raised alerts during the specified time period, additional filters for alert severity and priority can be added to scope report output.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.

When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. The contained objects should relate to what raised the alert. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Severity: Allows filtering alerts by severity. The default is all severities.
Priority: Allows filtering alerts by priority. The default is all priorities.
Scenario: Report on priority 1 alerts raised by the group “All Computers” for Monday to Friday last week.
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
In search box type All Computers then click Search
Highlight group All Computers then click Add
On Priority parameter uncheck all except Priority 1

maml:section.maml:para: Report Output:

maml:entry.maml:para: Shows the name of the Alert
How many times this alert was raised
The object that raised the alert
When the alert was first raised
When the alert was last raised

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report helps to isolate issues in monitoring with System Center Operations Manager by showing the logging latency of an alert for selected objects over time

The Alert Logging Latency report shows the time an alert takes from being picked up on the agent to the time it is written to the database. Every alert written to the database is time stamped and the time the alert was raised on the agent is subtracted to give you the latency. This report allows comparing the reported latencies against a threshold which can be entered as a parameter.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.

When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. The contained objects should relate to what raised the alert. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Threshold: Allows filtering on alerts with latency over a certain period of time from 1 second to 30 minutes.
Chart Scale: Drives the charts x-axis units and determines if it is hourly, daily or monthly
Scenario: Report on all alerts raised by the group “All Computers” and show whether they were under a 15 second logging latency threshold for Monday to Friday last week.
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
In search box type All Computers then click Search
Highlight group All Computers then click Add

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows for selected objects the time in state during the selected report duration. Time in state is summarized by default as per the objects availability Monitors

For every managed object within System Center Operations Manager, monitors configured in each of the disciplines below determine an objects time in state and then roll-up to an objects overall health. The availability report by default shows an objects time in state as per the monitors that roll-up within the availability discipline.
Data Aggregation: Report can be run using the hourly or daily aggregations of data.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.

Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range. Business hours only works if hourly aggregation is selected.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.

Downtime: When calculating downtime for an object in the report a user can specify whether certain states count as up or downtime. By checking the box next to the state this determines that state to be downtime.
Scenario: Report on the availability of all computers in group “All Computers” for Monday to Friday last week and select warning as a downtime state.
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
In search box type All Computers then click Search
Highlight group All Computers then click Add

maml:section.maml:para: Report Output:
The report offers three areas of interaction

maml:entry.maml:para: Drilling-down the state rollup logic defined for the selected object
A click on the "Object name" launches the "Monitor Availability" sub-report that details which monitor(s) have been reporting which states.

This links to an "Availability time" report that shows in detail what times the object has been in what state and allows drill-downs in time to detail on a monthly, daily and hourly base a time in state.
The same links as clicking on the Object name
The same links as clicking on the Availability Tracker chart
This links to the configuration changes and runs for the same time range an object that details every configuration change detected.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows for selected objects the time in state during the selected report duration. Time in state is summarized by default as per the objects overall entity health

For every managed object within System Center Operations Manager, monitors configured in each of the disciplines below determine an objects time in state and then roll-up to an objects overall health. The health report by default shows an objects time in state as per the monitors that roll-up within the overall entity health.
Data Aggregation: Report can be run using the hourly or daily aggregations of data.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.

Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range. Business hours only works if hourly aggregation is selected.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.

Downtime: When calculating downtime for an object in the report a user can specify whether certain states count as up or downtime. By checking the box next to the state this determines that state to be downtime.
Scenario: Report on the health of all computers in group “All Computers” for Monday to Friday last week and select warning as a downtime state.
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
In search box type All Computers then click Search
Highlight group All Computers then click Add

maml:section.maml:para: Report Output:
The report offers three areas of interaction

maml:entry.maml:para: Drilling-down the state rollup logic defined for the selected object
A click on the "Object name" launches the "Monitor Availability" sub-report that details which monitor(s) have been reporting which states.

This links to an "Availability time" report that shows in detail what times the object has been in what state and allows drill-downs in time to detail on a monthly, daily and hourly base a time in state.
The same links as clicking on the Object name
The same links as clicking on the Availability Tracker chart
This links to the configuration changes and runs for the same time range an object that details every configuration change detected.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows for selected objects the changes in configuration over time

Management Packs contain discoveries that collect object properties that are relevant for the management of the application. The data for the reports is derived from a delta-discovery done in the data warehouse where each discovery value is compared to the last known. If a change is detected, the changed property, the old and the new value and the time the change was discovered are recorded in the data warehouse.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Scenario: Report on all the discovery configuration changes for the Root Management Server Emulator for Monday to Friday last week.
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
In search box type Root Management then click Search
Highlight group Root Management Server Emulator Computer Group then click Add

maml:section.maml:para: Report Output:
Any configuration change is shown with the time the discovery detected it, the property, the old and the new value.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows configuration data filtered by all entered parameters.

A management pack contains discoveries that collect information specific to the management pack. For all selected objects this report displays the properties discovered by management packs. By checking the box a property can be selected to be printed on the report. The controls to the right allow defining the order of the selected properties from left (higher in the parameter list) to right (lower in the parameter list).
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Report fields: Allows defining which properties to filter on an which to print in which order
Scenario: Report on the “Display Name, DNS Name and IP Address” properties for the Root Management Server Emulator for Monday to Friday last week.
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
In search box type Root Management then click Search
Highlight group Root Management Server Emulator Computer Group then click Add
In Report Fields select “Display Name, DNS Name and IP Address”

maml:section.maml:para: Report Output:

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows a table of events and a count by server filtered by all entered parameters.

A Management Pack contains event collection rules that collect specific event information. The list of event details is defined by the rules collecting the events. This report allows you to analyze specific events.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Source: Allows filtering by the Event Source. The default is all.
Type: Allows filtering by the Event type. The default is all.
Category: Allows filtering on the Event Category. The default is all.
Event ID: Allows filtering for specific Event ID.
Scenario: Report on all Category 1 events from the Root Management Server Emulator for Monday to Friday last week
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
In search box type Root Management then click Search
Highlight group Root Management Server Emulator Computer Group then click Add

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows event data filtered by all selected parameters

A Management Pack contains event collection rules that collect specific event information. The list of event details is defined by the rules collecting the events. By checking the box a detail of the Event can be selected to be printed on the report. The controls to the right allow defining the order of the selected items from left (higher in the parameter list) to right (lower in the parameter list).
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Report fields: Allows defining which properties to filter on an which to print in which order
Scenario: Report on all Operations Manager 1210 events from the Root Management Server Emulator for Monday to Friday last week. Run report so show Event ID, Date and Channel.
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
In search box type Root Management then click Search
Highlight group Root Management Server Emulator Computer Group then click Add
In Report Fields select “Event ID, Date, Channel”
Highlight Event ID and click Filter

maml:section.maml:para: Report Output:

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows for selected objects the most common alerts raised during the selected report duration and for given filter parameters

The Most Common Alerts report helps to identify high volume alerts, the MP they originate from, the volume a distinct alert contributes to the total number of alerts and the resolution times. This report is a help in tuning alerts.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Management Pack Selector: Allows selection of specific or all Management Packs to analyze
N: This numeric value is used to filter the alerts shown in the Management Pack selection
Scenario: Report on the top 5 most common alerts from all Management Packs for Monday to Friday last week
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows for selected objects the most common events raised during the selected report duration and for given filter parameters

The Most Common Events report helps to identify high volume events, the agent they originated from and the volume a distinct event contributes to the total number of events. This report is a help in tuning events.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Source: Allows filtering by the Event Source. The default is all.
Type: Allows filtering by the Event type. The default is all.
Category: Allows filtering on the Event Category. The default is all.
N: This numeric value is used to filter the events shown.
Scenario: Report on the top 5 events from the Root Management Server Emulator for Monday to Friday last week
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
In search box type Root Management then click Search
Highlight group Root Management Server Emulator Computer Group then click Add

maml:section.maml:para: Report Output:

maml:listItem.maml:para: A chart and table showing the overall most common Events

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows overrides configured in or applied to selected management packs over time.

The report retrieves overrides defined or applied to a selected list of management packs during specific time interval. The result list can contain more than one record for a specific override if the override had been changed during the reported time period. Detailed section of the report shows list of all versions of the management pack the override was defined in.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.

Select Criteria: Switches the report between selecting all Overrides defined or applied to a set of Management Packs. If "DEFINED IN" option is selected all overrides that are defined in the specified Management Packs will be selected. For "APPLIED TO" option the report filters data to select only Overrides that override elements in the list of selected Management Packs. Select Criteria parameter does not change the report grouping of formatting; it only affects Override filtering criteria. Default value is "DEFINED IN".
Exclude Sealed MPs: YES OR NO to showing overrides from Sealed MPs
Management Pack Selector: Allows selection of specific or all Management Packs to analyze
Management Group: Allows selection of specific or all Management Packs to analyze

Note: "Management Group", "Select Criteria", "Exclude sealed MP overrides" and "Management Pack" parameters are dependent on each other in the order they specified in the parameter block. Changing one of them can result in changing dependent ones to a default value.
Scenario: Report on all overrides defined in all non-sealed MPs for Monday to Friday last week
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows Overrides configured in or applied to selected management packs over time.

The report retrieves overrides defined or applied to a selected list of management packs during specific time interval. The result list provides details like username, object name, type of object, old value, new value for the performed overrides. There can be more than one record for a specific override when multiple parameters are changed. Detailed section of the report shows list of all versions of the management pack the override was defined in.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.

Select Criteria: Switches the report between selecting all Overrides defined or applied to a set of Management Packs. If "DEFINED IN" option is selected all overrides that are defined in the specified Management Packs will be selected. For "APPLIED TO" option the report filters data to select only Overrides that override elements in the list of selected Management Packs. Select Criteria parameter does not change the report grouping of formatting; it only affects Override filtering criteria. Default value is "DEFINED IN".
Exclude Sealed MPs: YES OR NO to showing overrides from Sealed MPs
Management Pack Selector: Allows selection of specific or all Management Packs to analyze
Management Group: Allows selection of specific or all Management Packs to analyze
Type of Objects: Results can be filtered by Monitors, Rules, Groups, Discoveries and more
Username: Allows filtering on username(s). Multiple username can be entered and separated using semicolon (;)

Note: "Management Group", "Select Criteria", "Exclude sealed MP overrides" and "Management Pack" parameters are dependent on each other in the order they specified in the parameter block. Changing one of them can result in changing dependent ones to a default value.
Scenario: Report on all overrides defined in all non-sealed MPs for Monday to Friday last week
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
Select Type of Objects as Monitor

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Management pack Object report lists down the newly added/deleted management pack objects on the SCOM management server. This report also shows the edits which happened on the MP objects.

This report retrieves details when a new monitors, rules, discoveries and groups, diagnostics, recovery, module types is either created or imported; and by whom and when. The report also lists any deletion or edit that happens to the management pack objects.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.

Action Criteria: Allows filtering on the actions which are New, Delete or Edit. New lists all the new objects, delete lists all the deleted objects and edit list the changes like name or description change for object(s)
Username: Allows filtering on username(s). Multiple username can be entered and separated using semicolon (;)
Type of Objects: By default, option “All Type of Objects” is selected. Results can be filtered for the selected management objects from the drop-down list
Scenario: Report all new monitors created/imported from Monday to Friday last week by user Dan and Bob
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday
Select Type of Objects as Monitor

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Management pack History report shows all the management packs which are either installed or deleted on SCOM management servers.

This report retrieves details for every management pack install or delete happened on any management server for the selected duration. The results will display management pack name, version, action (install or delete) and the user who have performed the action.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Action Criteria: Allows filtering on the actions which are install or delete
Username: Allows filtering on username(s). Multiple username can be entered and separated using semicolon (;)
Scenario: Report on all management packs installed from Monday to Friday last week by user Dan and Bob
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows the newly added/uninstalled agents on the SCOM management server. This report also shows the changes which happened on the monitoring agents.
This report retrieves details on agent installation, Repair, upgrade, and uninstallation. It also provides information on who performed the agent related changes and when it was made.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Type of Action: Allows filtering on the actions which are installation, Repair, upgrade, and uninstallation.
Username: Allows filtering on username(s). Multiple username can be entered and separated using semicolon (;)
Type of Objects: By default, option “All Type of Objects” is selected. Query can be filtered with type of agent i.e., Windows vs Unix/Linux.
Agent Name: Allows filtering on agent name(s). Multiple agent names can be entered and separated using semicolon (;). User can also provide name which will be used as a wildcard search.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Scenario: Report all new agents installed from Monday to Friday last week by user Dan and Bob.
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report lists down the monitors on which Health reset has been performed over time.
This report retrieves details on monitors such as name and entity. It also provides information on who performed the health reset and when it was made.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Monitor name: Allows filtering on monitor name(s). Multiple monitor names can be entered and separated using semicolon (;). User can also provide name which will be used as a wildcard search.
Username: Allows filtering on username(s). Multiple username can be entered and separated using semicolon (;)
Scenario: Report all monitors on which health reset was performed from Monday to Friday last week by user Dan and Bob.
Instructions: (Parameter selections shown in bold)

maml:listItem.maml:para: Select From drop down and choose Previous Week > Monday
Select To drop down choose Previous Week > Friday

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows selected objects and performance counter values graphically over time

The report offers adding one or multiple charts and display data as historical chart or histograms. This report sources from hourly or daily aggregated data. For the selected time range the report allows to report on performance data with charts and a data tables.
Data Aggregation: Report can be run using the hourly or daily aggregations of data.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.

Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range. Business hours only works if hourly aggregation is selected.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Histogram: Allows selecting the values used for the x-axis of the report
3D Chart: Allows choosing if the report is shown in a flat or a 3D image

Note: Most performance counters are targeted at the Windows Operating System so when using the Object Picker select object of class “Windows Operating System”. If you select Windows Computer performance information will only be shown if you use Add Group.

Report on a single performance counter. After adding a chart and a series a User can select one performance counter (or performance counter rule) and the object to report on. For each series the color, the style and the scale can be chosen. The up and down buttons on the right side of the control allow to control the z-order which defines an order from front to back in the chart. This is used to avoid overlaying a line chart chosen for one series with the area chart chosen for a different series in the same chart.

Report on an average value across a group of objects. If more than one object is added to a series the same performance data is averaged across all objects. This allows creating a chart showing an average of free database space across a number of Servers hosting a particular database. A drill-down to the Performance detail report allows exploding with a link in "Actions" an averaged series and displaying individual charts for every contained object.

Report on multiple counters for a similar subject. To analyze memory performance a number of performance counters need to be compared. Using multiple series with different styles and colors the analysis can be tuned with different scales and z-ordering. E.g. performance data indicating load can use an area chart and be order in the back while the user activity indicating counters can use line charts and be order to the front. Using the Histogram parameter a report configured in this way can be used to understand during what time of the day or what day in the month what User load results in what system load. After a report is rendered it is possible to save all configuration setting using a friendly name to favorites.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows selected objects and performance counter values graphically over time
This report shows a series with these fixed settings:

maml:entry.maml:para: Average is shown as a black line
Standard Deviation is shown as an orange area
The area between the lowest to the highest value is filled with blue color.

maml:section.maml:para: If a Histogram is specified, this report displays a link to a table detailing average, min, max and standard deviation for all time periods averaged into one x-axis unit. A second, smaller chart details the number of performance counter samples making up this report.
Data Aggregation: Report can be run using the hourly or daily aggregations of data.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.

Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range. Business hours only works if hourly aggregation is selected.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Histogram: Allows selecting the values used for the x-axis of the report
3D Chart: Allows choosing if the report is shown in a flat or a 3D image

Note: Most performance counters are targeted at the Windows Operating System so when using the Object Picker select object of class “Windows Operating System”. If you select Windows Computer performance information will only be shown if you use Add Group.
Understand load. Use this report to display performance data that indicates User load.

With a histogram of "Daily by hours" the report helps to understand at which time of the day what load is to be expected (the standard deviation in orange) and could be happening (the min to max values in blue).

Learn about historical capacity needs. Use this report to display performance data indicating capacity usage (e.g. free disk space) This report run over six month worth of data shows the development of the capacity needs if the parameter Histogram = "No" is chosen.

Understand the average and drill to the details. This report allows adding to a chart series for a single performance data item more than one object. (E.g. adding to a % free database space for the SAP database all the Servers hosting the SAP database). After rendering the report the Actions menu offers a link to break out the series per object (e.g. allowing the review charts for each individual Server)

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows for selected objects and a specific performance counter rule the top or bottom “N” objects.

This report shows a chart and a table. The chart shows columns for every found object starting at 0 to the max or min value for the selected reporting time range. The chart also indicates with a black error bar the fluctuation in value of this object for the selected reporting time range. If the error bar is very small this object was for the reporting time range always close to value displayed by the column. If it is very wide the object fluctuates and the top or bottom value should be not taken as the value which is to be expected.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Algorithm: Allows choosing if Top or Bottom is the algorithm to use
N: Allows entering the value using in conjunction with the algorithm (e.g. Top 5)
Management Group: Allows choosing one or multiple Management Groups in the Warehouse to be included in this report
Rule: The rule which the algorithm is applied to.

Note: Most performance counters are targeted at the Windows Operating System so when using the Object Picker select object of class “Windows Operating System”. If you select Windows Computer performance information will only be shown if you use Add Group.

Find the most or least used objects. Down- and rightsizing teams are charged to find candidate for virtualization or consolidation. The report allows selecting a rule that monitors performance items monitoring the items to research and to specify a Top N or Bottom N value (e.g. the top 10
Find system in need of hardware upgrades
If a performance rule for the typical bottlenecks are used
For counters in these categories this report can be used to track across the Enterprise objects that are challenged by bottlenecks.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows for selected objects and a specific performance counter rule the top or bottom “N” instances

This report shows a chart and a table. The chart shows columns for every found object starting at 0 to the max or min value for the selected reporting time range. The chart also indicates with a black error bar the fluctuation in value of this object for the selected reporting time range. If the error bar is very small this object was for the reporting time range always close to value displayed by the column. If it is very wide the object fluctuates and the top or bottom value should be not taken as the value which is to be expected.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.
Algorithm: Allows choosing if Top or Bottom is the algorithm to use
N: Allows entering the value using in conjunction with the algorithm (e.g. Top 5)
Rule: The rule which the algorithm is applied to.

Note: Most performance counters are targeted at the Windows Operating System so when using the Object Picker select object of class “Windows Operating System”. If you select Windows Computer performance information will only be shown if you use Add Group.

Find the most or least used objects. Down- and rightsizing teams are charged to find candidate for virtualization or consolidation. The report allows selecting a rule that monitors performance items monitoring the items to research and to specify a Top N or Bottom N value (e.g. the top 10
Find system in need of hardware upgrades
If a performance rule for the typical bottlenecks are used
For counters in these categories this report can be used to track across the Enterprise objects that are challenged by bottlenecks.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows selected objects and performance counter values graphically over time

The report offers adding one or multiple charts and display data as historical chart or histograms. This report sources from hourly or daily aggregated data. For the selected time range the report allows to report on performance data with charts and a data tables.
Data Aggregation: Report can be run using the hourly or daily aggregations of data.
Date/Time Selection: Allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates.

Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range. Business hours only works if hourly aggregation is selected.
Object Picker: Allows selection of Groups or Objects to show Alerts for.
When using the object picker selecting Add Group will return the Group and all objects it contains. Add Object returns only the selected object.
Histogram: Allows selecting the values used for the x-axis of the report
3D Chart: Allows choosing if the report is shown in a flat or a 3D image

Note: Most performance counters are targeted at the Windows Operating System so when using the Object Picker select object of class “Windows Operating System”. If you select Windows Computer performance information will only be shown if you use Add Group.

Report on a single performance counter. After adding a chart and a series a User can select one performance counter (or performance counter rule) and the object to report on. For each series the color, the style and the scale can be chosen. The up and down buttons on the right side of the control allow to control the z-order which defines an order from front to back in the chart. This is used to avoid overlaying a line chart chosen for one series with the area chart chosen for a different series in the same chart.

Report on an average value across a group of objects. If more than one object is added to a series the same performance data is averaged across all objects. This allows creating a chart showing an average of free database space across a number of Servers hosting a particular database. A drill-down to the Performance detail report allows exploding with a link in "Actions" an averaged series and displaying individual charts for every contained object.

Report on multiple counters for a similar subject. To analyze memory performance a number of performance counters need to be compared. Using multiple series with different styles and colors the analysis can be tuned with different scales and z-ordering. E.g. performance data indicating load can use an area chart and be order in the back while the user activity indicating counters can use line charts and be order to the front. Using the Histogram parameter a report configured in this way can be used to understand during what time of the day or what day in the month what User load results in what system load. After a report is rendered it is possible to save all configuration setting using a friendly name to favorites.
